urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
Rivers across England may be at risk of flooding after heavy rainfall brought by #StormChristoph.  
 
Stay safe and keep your distance from flooded rivers. 

Find out if a river near you is affected: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/tiFX4tUorr

Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv

tweets.text:
Please stay off Rawcliffe Ings and the associated flood embankments, we are already seeing overtopping from the River Ouse into the flood water holding area. Photo taken under the A1237 bridge.
@EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork  @YorkMix @yorkpress @BBCYork https://t.co/z4Lr2435qc

Heavy rainfall across England may cause rivers to overflow. Keep your distance and stay safe. 

If you need to go out, check your local #flood risk first: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/NUld5Ux9c9
Road not passable unless you have a boat? Shelsley Beauchamp https://t.co/yfPo6EltBt

It stressed me seeing Water Voles paddling through pollution in this ditch so thanks to @GolfStarcross for giving me access to clear it, now it needs the authorities to clean up oil slick from road & railway @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail https://t.co/q53q754Ox8

tweets.text: @JoKingDevon @GolfStarcross @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail Well that's good news. I've walked and cycled past there so many times without looking.

#StormChristoph is here! Our partners in the #Yorkshire & #Humber region have invested in smart and sustainable #flood prevention #solutions to #save lives and property. Thanks to @Hullfloodrisk @EnvAgencyYNE @Hullfloodrisk @East_Riding @CityofYork @floodinnovation @YorkshirePFR

@JoKingDevon @GolfStarcross @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail I remember walking past there a couple of years ago and being horrified at the rubbish. Picked a couple of nearby bits up but didn‚Äôt have anyway of getting others. Is it car drivers or people on the golf course? (Maybe both).
@CRTContactUs @EnvAgency So @CanalRiverTrust aren‚Äôt responsible for the #RiverAire #Leeds @CRTContactUs

@SCcrowther @EnvAgencyYNE One of our Specialist Materials & Logistics Officers (Bill) calculated to do the same defence with sandbags it would require approx 16,000!

Temp barriers like this save time, resource, cost and are much more environmentally friendly!

@Mr_ian_B @GolfStarcross @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail Yes they‚Äôre so close to the path too, someone told me last year that he‚Äôd often seen them and I didn‚Äôt believe him, then I saw them for myself in broad daylight

Our #FieldTeam from @EnvAgencyYNE have today installed some temporary barrier along the #RiverDon in #Doncaster.

This barrier protects an access route to one of the #Covid19 vaccination centres.

It‚Äôs a precautionary measure in case the forecast worsens. https://t.co/IHErO1V8Y8

@JoKingDevon @GolfStarcross @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail Well done Jo and thank you from the water voles xx https://t.co/Evxo4YGfse

tweets.text: Flood Impact Timeline - Update 3: here‚Äôs our latest as the rain from #StormChristoph works it through the nation‚Äôs river networks. We‚Äôve added some amber to green colour to give a flavour of where risk is higher. Still 370+ flood warnings & alerts live https://t.co/K5GUW3z87V https://t.co/6vlNg6KYia
FLOODS: there‚Äôs an @EnvAgencyYNE warning for flooding on the River Aire at Cottingley- here looking at @BEESRUGBY it‚Äôs not hard to see why! https://t.co/LOI7eK37N1

Flooding in Dallam means a number of residents remain cut off, @CheshireFire and @manchesterfire using boats to access vulnerable and elderly.  @WarringtonBC have opened rest centre for anyone evacuated. Please continue to monitor @EnvAgencyNW as water levels remain high. https://t.co/QLi3yq8Cpm

Uk Floods Assistance: 

We‚Äôve got around 1000 sandbags in stock, bottled water, snacks and volunteers! 

If any #Floods hit community requires assistance pls DM.   

#StormChristoph 

@CheshireLive  @NPTCouncil @manchesterfire @northwaleslive

Extreme weather means flooding throughout Warrington North, with peak floods expected in the early hours of the morning. I'm liaising with the local authority and the emergency services about affected areas.

Please stay indoors where you can and follow @EnvAgencyNW for updates. https://t.co/P3M8WX3tsQ
